crossref.abstract: <jats:sec><jats:title>Objectives</jats:title><jats:p>To identify within-stakeholder agreement and between-stakeholder differences in beliefs regarding exercise for osteoarthritis among general practitioners (GPs), physiotherapists (PTs) and people with hip and knee osteoarthritis (PwOA). A secondary objective was to explore the association between referral patterns and beliefs of PwOA.</jats:p></jats:sec><jats:sec><jats:title>Design</jats:title><jats:p>Cross-sectional.</jats:p></jats:sec><jats:sec><jats:title>Setting</jats:title><jats:p>Online surveys administered to GPs, PTs and PwOA in Ireland via social media and healthcare networks.</jats:p></jats:sec><jats:sec><jats:title>Participants</jats:title><jats:p>421 valid responses (n=161 GPs, n=163 PTs, n=97 PwOA).</jats:p></jats:sec><jats:sec><jats:title>Primary and secondary outcome measures</jats:title><jats:p>Nine belief statements related to exercise effectiveness, safety and delivery were rated on a 5-point Likert scale and analysed for within-stakeholder consensus. χ<jats:sup>2</jats:sup>tests assessed differences in agreement between groups. Multivariable linear regression models tested associations between beliefs in PwOA and referral to/attendance at physiotherapy.</jats:p></jats:sec><jats:sec><jats:title>Results</jats:title><jats:p>Positive within-stakeholder consensus (>75% agreement) was reached for most statements (7/9 GPs, 6/9 PTs, 5/9 PwOA). However, beliefs of PwOA were significantly less positive compared with healthcare professionals for six statements. All stakeholders disagreed that exercise is effective regardless of the level of pain. Attendance at physiotherapy (49% of PwOA), rather than referral to physiotherapy from a GP only, was associated with positive exercise beliefs for PwOA (β=0.287 (95% CI 0.299 to 1.821)).</jats:p></jats:sec><jats:sec><jats:title>Conclusions</jats:title><jats:p>Beliefs about exercise therapy for osteoarthritis are predominantly positive across all stakeholders, although less positive in PwOA. PwOA are more likely to have positive beliefs if they have seen a PT for their osteoarthritis. Knowledge translation should highlight the effectiveness of exercise for all levels of pain and osteoarthritis disease.</jats:p></jats:sec>
title: Guideline-based exercise management for hip and knee osteoarthritis: a cross-sectional comparison of healthcare professional and patient beliefs in Ireland
